text.title: COURT DIMENSIONS
text.description: The FIBA basketball court measures 91.86 feet by 49.21 feet (28m x 15m), slightly smaller than the NBA court.

text.title: GAME TIMING
text.description: A FIBA game consists of four 10-minute quarters. Overtime periods last 5 minutes.

text.title: THREE-POINT LINE
text.description: The three-point line is uniformly 22.15 feet (6.75m) from the basket, compared to the variable distance in the NBA.

text.title: TIMEOUTS
text.description: Each team has two timeouts in the first half and three in the second half, with a limit of two in the final 2 minutes of the game. Only coaches can call timeouts.

text.title: FOULS
text.description: Players are disqualified after 5 personal fouls in FIBA games, compared to 6 in the NBA.
